title: Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection72 (Slavery 7)
description:
Criticism of the Western Civilization - Collection 72 (Slavery 7):

We have 30 titles here:

-  Davis - From Homicide to Slavery; Studies in American Culture (1986)

-  De Wet - Preaching Bondage; John Chrysostom and the Discourse of Slavery in Early Christianity (2015)

-  Dumas - Proslavery Britain; Fighting for Slavery in an Era of Abolition (2016)

-  Eltis & Engerman (Ed.) - The Cambridge World History of Slavery, Vol. 3, AD 1420 - AD 1804 (2011)

-  Farrow et al - Complicity; How the North Promoted, Prolonged, and Profited from Slavery (2005)

-  Gates & Yacovone - The African Americans; Many Rivers to Cross (2013)

-  Greenberg - Masters and Statement; the Political Culture of American Slavery (1985)

-  Hawthorne - From Africa to Brazil; Culture, Identity, and an Atlantic Slave Trade, 1600-1830 (2010)

-  Holland - The Invisibles; the Untold Story of African American Slaves in the White House (2016)

-  Hutson - On the Treatment and Management of the More Common West- India Diseases, 1750-1802 (2005)

-  Kennedy - Mr. Jeffersonâ€™s Lost Cause; Land, Farmers, Slavery, and the Louisiana Purchase (2003)

-  Lindsay & Sweet (Eds.) - Biography and the Black Atlantic (2014)

-  Manning - Slavery, Colonialism and Economic Growth in Dahomey, 1640-1960 (1982)

-  Moitt - Women and Slavery in the French Antilles, 1635-1848 (2001)

-  Morgan - American Slavery, American Freedom (1975)

-  Nwokeji - The Slave Trade and Culture in the Bight of Biafra; an African Society in the Atlantic World (2010)

-  Portnoy - Their Right to Speak; Womenâ€™s Activism in the Indian and Slave Debates (2005)

-  Resendez - The Other Slavery; the Uncovered Story of Indian Enslavement in America (2016)

-  Richardson & da Silva (Eds.) - Networks and Trans-Cultural Exchange; Slave Trading in the South Atlantic, 1590-1867 (2015)

-  Samford - Subfloor Pits and the Archaeology of Slavery in Colonial Virginia (2007)

-  Sayers - A Desolate Place for a Defiant People; the Archaeology of Maroons, Indigenous Americans, and Enslaved Laborers.. (2014)

-  Schafer - Zephaniah Kingsley Jr. and the Atlantic World; Slave Trader, Plantation Owner, Emancipator (2013)

-  Sinha - The Slave's Cause; a History of Abolition (2016)

-  Smith - Mental Slavery; Psychoanalytic Studies of Caribbean People (2000)

-  Smith - Slavery, Family and Gentry Capitalism in the British Atlantic (2006)

-  Stanton - 'Those Who Labor for My Happiness'; Slavery at Thomas Jefferson's Monticello (2012)

-  Stevenson - Life in Black and White; Family and Community in the Slave South (1996)

-   Tawil - The Making Of Racial Sentiment; Slavery and the Birth of the Frontier Romance (2006)

-  Tillet - Sites of Slavery; Citizenship and Racial Democracy in the Post-Civil Rights Imagination (2012)

-  Williams - African American Autobiography and the Quest for Freedom (2000)
